identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Intensive Cognitive Rehabilitation in Subacute Stroke Patient
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Intensive Cognitive Rehabilitation in Subacute Stroke Patient

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Early stroke rehabilitation is known to be an effective and essential therapy in gaining functional independence and preventing complications. However, there was no consensus of proper amount of cognitive rehabilitation in stroke patients. In this study, the investigators assess the effects of the intensive cognitive rehabilitation during subacute phase to improve cognitive function at 6 months after onset in patients with first-ever strokes.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Intensive cognitive rehabilitation group

* cognitive therapy for 1 hours on every working day for 4 weeks

Conventional cognitive rehabilitation group

* cognitive therapy for 30 minutes on every working day for 4 weeks

armGroups.label: Intensive group
armGroups.description: cognitive rehabilitation therapy for 1 hour by cognitive therapist on every working day for 4 weeks

armGroups.label: Conventional group
armGroups.description: cognitive rehabilitation therapy for 30 minutes by cognitive therapist on every working day for 4 weeks

interventions.name: Cognitive rehabilitation
interventions.description: Intensive cognitive rehabilitation by cognitive therapist for 1 hours on every working day during subacute stroke phase

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change of K-MoCa after intensive cognitive rehabilitation for 4 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Acute first-ever stroke
* Korean Mini-Mental State Examination: 11\~24 at 7 days after stroke onset

Exclusion Criteria:

* Transient ischemic stroke
